SKILLS I

스킬 개요

SKILLS SUMMARY

If you buy a class skill, your character gets 1 rank (equal to a +1 bonus on checks with that skill) for each skill point. If you buy other classes’ 스킬 (cross-직업 스킬), you get 1/2 rank per skill point.

Your maximum rank in a class skill is your character 레벨 + 3.

Your maximum rank in a cross-class skill is one-half of this number (do not round up or down).

스킬 사용하기: To make a skill check, roll: 1d20 + skill modifier (Skill modifier = skill rank + ability modifier + 기타 modifiers)

This roll works just like an 명중 굴림 or a 내성 굴림— the higher the roll, the better. Either you’re trying to match or exceed a certain 난이도 등급 (DC), or you’re trying to beat another character’s check result.

Skill Ranks: A character’s number of ranks in a skill is based on how many skill points a character has invested in a skill. Many 스킬 can be used even if the character has no ranks in them; doing this is called making an untrained skill check.

Ability Modifier: The ability modifier used in a skill check is the modifier for the skill’s key ability (the ability associated with the skill’s use). The key ability of each skill is noted in its 묘사.

기타 Modifiers: 기타 modifiers include racial bonuses, 갑옷 check penalties, and bonuses provided by 특기, among others.

Each skill point you spend on a class skill gets you 1 rank in that skill. 직업 스킬 are the 스킬 found on your character’s class skill list. Each skill point you spend on a cross-class skill gets your character 1/2 rank in that skill. Cross-직업 스킬 are 스킬 not found on your character’s class skill list. (Half ranks do not improve your skill check, but two 1/2 ranks make 1 rank.) You can’t save skill points to spend later.

The maximum rank in a class skill is the character’s 레벨 + 3. If it’s a cross-class skill, the maximum rank is half of that number (do not round up or down).

Regardless of whether a skill is purchased as a class skill or a cross-class skill, if it is a class skill for any of your classes, your maximum rank equals your total character 레벨 + 3.

스킬 사용하기

USING SKILLS

When your character uses a skill, you make a skill check to see how well he or she does. The higher the result of the skill check, the better. Based on the circumstances, your result must match or beat a particular number (a DC or the result of an opposed skill check) for the check to be successful. The harder the task, the higher the number you need to roll.

Circumstances can affect your check. A character who is free to work without distractions can make a careful attempt and avoid simple mistakes. A character who has lots of time can try over and over again, thereby assuring the best outcome. If others help, the character may succeed where otherwise he or she would fail.

스킬 판정

SKILL CHECKS

A skill check takes into account a character’s training (skill rank), natural talent (ability modifier), and luck (the die roll). It may also take into account his or her race’s knack for doing certain things (racial bonus) or what 갑옷 he or she is wearing (갑옷 check penalty), or a certain feat the character possesses, among other things.

To make a skill check, roll 1d20 and add your character’s skill modifier for that skill. The skill modifier incorporates the character’s ranks in that skill and the ability modifier for that skill’s key ability, plus any other 기타 modifiers that may apply, including racial bonuses and 갑옷 check penalties. The higher the result, the better. Unlike with 명중 굴림 and 내성 굴림, a natural roll of 20 on the d20 is not an automatic success, and a natural roll of 1 is not an automatic failure.

난이도 등급
Difficulty Class

Some checks are made against a 난이도 등급 (DC). The DC is a number (set using the skill rules as a guideline) that you must score as a result on your skill check in order to succeed.

대항 판정
Opposed Checks

An opposed check is a check whose success or failure is determined by comparing the check result to another character’s check result. In an opposed check, the higher result succeeds, while the lower result fails. In case of a tie, the higher skill modifier wins. If these scores are the same, roll again to break the tie.

다시 시도하기
Trying Again

In general, you can try a skill check again if you fail, and you can keep trying indefinitely. Some 스킬, however, have consequences of failure that must be taken into account. A few 스킬 are virtually useless once a check has failed on an attempt to accomplish a particular task. For most 스킬, when a character has succeeded once at a given task, additional successes are meaningless.

비숙련 스킬 판정
Untrained Skill Checks

Generally, if your character attempts to use a skill he or she does not possess, you make a skill check as normal. The skill modifier doesn’t have a skill rank added in because the character has no ranks in the skill. Any other applicable modifiers, such as the modifier for the skill’s key ability, are applied to the check.

Many 스킬 can be used only by someone who is trained in them.

호조건 및 악조건
Favorable and Unfavorable Conditions

Some situations may make a skill easier or harder to use, resulting in a bonus or penalty to the skill modifier for a skill check or a change to the DC of the skill check.

The chance of success can be altered in four ways to take into account exceptional circumstances.

1. Give the skill user a +2 circumstance bonus to represent 상태이상 that improve performance, such as having the perfect tool for the job, getting help from another character (see 스킬 시도를 조합하기), or possessing unusually accurate information.

2. Give the skill user a –2 circumstance penalty to represent 상태이상 that hamper performance, such as being forced to use improvised tools or having misleading information.

3. Reduce the DC by 2 to represent circumstances that make the task easier, such as having a friendly audience or doing work that can be subpar.

4. Increase the DC by 2 to represent circumstances that make the task harder, such as having an uncooperative audience or doing work that must be flawless.

상태이상 that affect your character’s ability to 공연 the skill change the skill modifier. 상태이상 that modify how well the character has to 공연 the skill to succeed change the DC. A bonus to the skill modifier and a reduction in the check’s DC have the same result: They create a better chance of success. But they represent different circumstances, and sometimes that difference is important.

시간 및 스킬 판정
Time and Skill Checks

Using a skill might take a round, take no time, or take several rounds or even longer. Most skill uses are 표준 행동, 이동 행동, or 전체 라운드 행동. Types of actions define how long activities take to 공연 within the framework of a 전투 round (6 seconds) and how 이동 is treated with respect to the activity. Some 스킬 판정 are instant and represent reactions to an event, or are included as part of an action.

These 스킬 판정 are not actions. Other 스킬 판정 represent part of 이동.

굴림 없이 판정
Checks without Rolls

A skill check represents an attempt to accomplish some goal, usually while under some sort of time pressure or distraction. Sometimes, though, a character can use a skill under more favorable 상태이상 and eliminate the luck factor.

Taking 10: When your character is not being threatened or distracted, you may choose to take 10. Instead of rolling 1d20 for the skill check, calculate your result as if you had rolled a 10. For many routine tasks, taking 10 makes them automatically successful. Distractions or threats (such as 전투) make it impossible for a character to take 10. In most cases, taking 10 is purely a safety measure —you know (or expect) that an average roll will succeed but 공포 that a poor roll might fail, so you elect to settle for the average roll (a 10). Taking 10 is especially useful in situations where a particularly high roll wouldn’t help.

Taking 20:When you have plenty of time (generally 2 minutes for a skill that can normally be checked in 1 round, one full-round action, or one standard action), you are faced with no threats or distractions, and the skill being attempted carries no penalties for failure, you can take 20. In other words, eventually you will get a 20 on 1d20 if you roll enough times. Instead of rolling 1d20 for the skill check, just calculate your result as if you had rolled a 20.

Taking 20 means you are trying until you get it right, and it assumes that you fail many times before succeeding. Taking 20 takes twenty times as long as making a single check would take.

Since taking 20 assumes that the character will fail many times before succeeding, if you did attempt to take 20 on a skill that carries penalties for failure, your character would automatically incur those penalties before he or she could complete the task. Common “take 20” 스킬 include 탈출 전문가, 자물쇠 열기, and 탐색.

능력 판정 and 시전자 레벨 Checks: The normal take 10 and take 20 rules apply for 능력 판정. Neither rule applies to 시전자 레벨 checks.

스킬 시도를 조합하기

COMBINING SKILL ATTEMPTS

When more than one character tries the same skill at the same time and for the same 목적, their efforts may overlap.

개별 사건
Individual Events

Often, several characters attempt some action and each succeeds or fails independently.  The result of one character’s 등반 check does not influence the results of other characters 등반 check.

보조하기
Aid Another

You can help another character achieve success on his or her skill check by making the same kind of skill check in a cooperative effort. If you roll a 10 or higher on your check, the character you are helping gets a +2 bonus to his or her check, as per the rule for favorable 상태이상. (You can’t take 10 on a skill check to 보조하기.) In many cases, a character’s help won’t be beneficial, or only a limited number of characters can help at once.

In cases where the skill restricts who can achieve certain results you can’t 보조하기 to grant a bonus to a task that your character couldn’t achieve alone.

스킬 시너지
Skill Synergy

It’s possible for a character to have two 스킬 that work well together. In general, having 5 or more ranks in one skill gives the character a +2 bonus on 스킬 판정 with each of its synergistic 스킬, as noted in the skill 묘사. In some cases, this bonus applies only to specific uses of the skill in question, and not to all checks. Some 스킬 provide benefits on other checks made by a character, such as those checks required to use certain 직업 특성.

능력 판정

ABILITY CHECKS

Sometimes a character tries to do something to which no specific skill really applies. In these cases, you make an ability check. An ability check is a roll of 1d20 plus the appropriate ability modifier. Essentially, you’re making an untrained skill check.

In some cases, an action is a straight test of one’s ability with no luck involved. Just as you wouldn’t make a height check to see who is taller, you don’t make a 근력 check to see who is stronger.

스킬 설명

SKILL DESCRIPTIONS

This section describes each skill, including common uses and typical modifiers. Characters can sometimes 스킬 사용 for 목적 other than those noted here.

Here is the format for 스킬 설명.

스킬 이름

SKILL NAME

The 스킬 이름 line includes (in addition to the 이름 of the skill) the following information.

Trained Only: If this notation is included in the 스킬 이름 line, you must have at least 1 rank in the skill to use it. If it is omitted, the skill can be used untrained (with a rank of 0). If any special notes apply to trained or untrained use, they are covered in the Untrained section (see below).

갑옷 Check Penalty: If this notation is included in the 스킬 이름 line, an 갑옷 check penalty applies (when appropriate) to checks using this skill. If this entry is absent, an 갑옷 check penalty does not apply.

The 스킬 이름 line is followed by a general 묘사 of what using the skill represents. After the 묘사 are a few other types of information:

Check: What a character (“you” in the skill 묘사) can do with a successful skill check and the check’s DC.

If the skill doesn’t allow you to attempt the same task more than once, or if failure carries an inherent penalty (such as with the 등반 skill), you can’t take 20. If this paragraph is omitted, the skill can be retried without any inherent penalty, other than the additional time required.

Synergy: Some 스킬 grant a bonus to the use of one or more other 스킬 because of a synergistic effect. This entry, when present, indicates what bonuses this skill may grant or receive because of such synergies. See Table 4–5 for a complete list of bonuses granted by synergy between 스킬 (or between a skill and a class feature).

Restriction: The full utility of certain 스킬 I restricted to characters of certain classes or characters who possess certain 특기. This entry indicates whether any such restrictions exist for the skill.

Untrained: This entry indicates what a character without at least 1 rank in the skill can do with it. If this entry doesn’t appear, it means that the skill functions normally for untrained characters (if it can be used untrained) or that an untrained character can’t attempt checks with this skill (for 스킬 that are designated as “Trained Only”).

허세 (Cha)

BLUFF (CHA)

Check: A 허세 check is opposed by the target’s 의도 파악 check. See the accompanying table for examples of different kinds of 허세 and the modifier to the target’s 의도 파악 check for each one.

Favorable and unfavorable circumstances weigh heavily on the outcome of a 허세. Two circumstances can weigh against you: The 허세 is hard to believe, or the action that the target is asked to take goes against its self-interest, nature, personality, orders, or the like. If it’s important, you can distinguish between a 허세 that fails because the target doesn’t believe it and one that fails because it just asks too much of the target. For instance, if the target gets a +10 bonus on its 의도 파악 check because the 허세 요구 something risky, and the 의도 파악 check succeeds by 10 or less, then the target didn’t so much see through the 허세 as prove reluctant to go along with it. A target that succeeds by 11 or more has seen through the 허세.

A successful 허세 check indicates that the target reacts as you 소원, at least for a short time (usually 1 round or less) or believes something that you want it to believe. 허세, however, is not a 제안 spell.

A 허세 requires interaction between you and the target. Creatures unaware of you cannot be bluffed.

Feinting in 전투: You can also use 허세 to 오도 an opponent in melee 전투 (so that it can’t 회피 your next 공격 effectively). To 속임동작, make a 허세 check opposed by your target’s 의도 파악 check, but in this case, the target may add its base 공격 보너스 to the roll along with any other applicable modifiers.

If your 허세 check result exceeds this special 의도 파악 check result, your target is denied its 민첩 bonus to AC (if any) for the next melee 공격 you make against it. This 공격 must be made on or before your next turn.

Feinting in this way against a nonhumanoid is difficult because it’s harder to read a strange creature’s body language; you take a –4 penalty on your 허세 check. Against a creature of animal 지능 (1 or 2) it’s even harder; you take a –8 penalty. Against a nonintelligent creature, it’s impossible.

Feinting in 전투 does not provoke an 공격 of opportunity.

Creating a Diversion to 숨기: You can use the 허세 skill to help you 숨기. A successful 허세 check gives you the momentary diversion you need to attempt a 숨기 check while people are aware of you. This usage does not provoke an 공격 of opportunity.

Delivering a Secret 통보: You can use 허세 to get a 통보 across to another character without others understanding it. The DC is 15 for simple 통보, or 20 for complex 통보, especially those that rely on getting across new information. Failure by 4 or less means you can’t get the 통보 across. Failure by 5 or more means that some false information has been implied or inferred. Anyone listening to the exchange can make a 의도 파악 check opposed by the 허세 check you made to transmit in order to intercept your 통보 (see 의도 파악).

Action: Varies. A 허세 check made as part of general interaction always takes at least 1 round (and is at least a full-round action), but it can take much longer if you try something elaborate. A 허세 check made to 속임동작 in 전투 or create a diversion to 숨기 is a standard action. A 허세 check made to deliver a secret 통보 doesn’t take an action; it is part of normal communication.

Try Again: Varies. Generally, a failed 허세 check in social interaction makes the target too suspicious for you to try again in the same circumstances, but you may retry freely on 허세 checks made to 속임동작 in 전투. Retries are also allowed when you are trying to send a 통보, but you may attempt such a retry only once per round.

Each retry carries the same chance of miscommunication.

Special: A 레인저 gains a bonus on 허세 checks when using this skill against a favored enemy.

The master of a 뱀 familiar gains a +3 bonus on 허세 checks.

If you have the 설득력 feat, you get a +2 bonus on 허세 checks.
